discriminate:
区别；辨别 
to notice and understand that one thing is different from another thing; to recognize a 
difference between things
dearth:
缺乏 
the state or condition of not having enough of something
recipe:
烹饪法；食谱 
a set of instructions that tells you how to cook something and the items of food you need 
for it

方法；秘诀；诀窍 
a method or an idea that seems likely to have a particular result
persevere:
坚持；孜孜以求 
to continue trying to do or achieve something in spite of difficulties
outrageous:
不可接受的 
very bad or wrong in a way that causes anger; too bad to be accepted or allowed

令人震惊的 
very strange or unusual; surprising or shocking
tenuous:
纤细的，易短的 
extremely thin and easily broken
eschew:
避免；避开 
to avoid (something) especially because you do not think it is right, proper, etc. 
158
appreciate:
欣赏；感激 
to understand the worth or importance of (something or someone); to admire and value 
(something or someone)
impotence:
无能 
the quality or state of being impotent
covert:
隐蔽的，偷偷摸摸的 
made, shown, or done in a way that is not easily seen or noticed; secret or hidden
toll:
道路、桥梁的通行费 
money that you pay to use a particular road or bridge

战争、灾难等造成的毁坏；伤亡人数 
the amount of damage or the number of deaths and injuries that are caused in a particular 
war, disaster, etc.

缓慢而有规律的钟声 
the sound of a bell ringing with slow regular strokes
astronomical:
天文学的 
of or relating to astronomy

数量，尤指费用极其巨大的，天文数字的 
extremely large
conundrum:
难题；复杂难解的问题 
a confusing or difficult problem
ubiquitous:
无处不在的 
seeming to be seen everywhere
vindictive:
有报复心的 
having or showing a desire to hurt someone who has hurt or caused problems for you
plankton:
浮游生物 
the very small forms of plant and animal life that live in seas, rivers, lakes, etc.
ambiance:
周围环境，氛围 
the mood or feeling of a particular place
cleave:
裂开，切开 
to split (something) by hitting it with something heavy and sharp 
159
archive:
档案馆 
a place in which public records or historical materials (such as documents) are kept
heretical:
异教的；异端的 
characterized by departure from accepted beliefs or standards
nostalgia:
乡愁；怀旧之情 
pleasure and sadness that is caused by remembering something from the past and wishing 
that you could experience it again
marginalize:
使边缘化 
to put or keep (someone) in a powerless or unimportant position within a society or group
timidity:
胆怯，胆小 
feeling or showing a lack of courage or confidence
devious:
曲折的；不坦诚的，狡猾的 
not direct;dishonest
torso:
身体的躯干 
the main part of the body, not including the head, arms or legs
rampant:
猖獗的；狂暴的 
growing quickly and in a way that is difficult to control
obedient:
遵从的 
willing to do what someone tells you to do or to follow a law, rule, etc.; willing to obey
stockpile:
囤聚的物资 
a large supply of something that is kept to be used in the future if necessary

大量贮备 
to collect and keep a large supply of something
strangle:
扼死 
to kill (a person or animal) by squeezing the throat

抑制 
to stop (something) from growing or developing
shack:
简陋的小屋；棚屋 
a small building, usually made of wood or metal, that has not been built well
smokescreen:
掩盖行动或真实意图的烟幕；幌子 
something designed to obscure, confuse, or mislead 
160
creep:
爬行 
to move slowly with the body close to the ground

讨厌的人 
a strange person who you strongly dislike
floral:
花的；有花形图案的，绘有花的 
made of flowers; consisting of pictures of flowers; decorated with pictures of flowers
terrestrial:
陆地的 
living or growing on land instead of in water or air
automaton:
自动化 
an apparatus that automatically performs certain actions by responding to preset controls or 
encoded instructions
humid:
潮湿的 
(of air and weather conditions) containing extremely small drops of water in the air
treason:
叛国 
the crime of betraying one's country, especially by attempting to kill the sovereign or 
overthrow the government
jolt:
使 震动，摇动，颠簸 
to move or to make somebody/something move suddenly and roughly

颠簸；震动；摇晃 
a sudden rough movement
secular:
世俗的，非宗教的 
not connected with spiritual or religious matters
agreeable:
令人愉快的，惬意的 
pleasing to the mind or senses
rash:
轻率的 
doing something quickly and without thinking carefully about what will happen as a result

疹子 
a group of red spots on the skin that is caused by an illness or a reaction to something
outcast:
被抛弃者；被排斥者 
a person who is not accepted by other people and who sometimes has to leave their home 
and friends
demise:
死亡 
an end of life 
161
hurl:
用力投掷 
to throw (something) with force

大声叫骂 
to say or shout (something, such as an insult) in a loud and forceful way
gaudy:
艳俗的 
too bright and heavily decorated
metropolitan:
大都会的，大城市的 
of or relating to a large city and the surrounding cities and towns
venerable:
因年高或睿智令人尊敬的； 因历史悠久而神圣庄严的 
old and respected; valued and respected because of old age, long use, etc.
sift:
筛 面粉、沙子等 
to put (flour, sugar, etc.) through a sifter or sieve

详查 
to go through (something) very carefully in order to find something useful or valuable
ponder:
仔细思考 
to think about or consider (something) carefully
placate:
安抚 
to cause (someone) to feel less angry about something
vernacular:
白话 
the language of ordinary speech rather than formal writing

白话的，方言的 
using a language or dialect native to a region or country rather than a literary, cultured, or 
foreign language
congregate:
集合，聚集 
to come together in a group or crowd
ephemeral:
短暂的 
lasting a very short time
affirm:
断言 
to say that something is true in a confident way
embolden:
鼓励 
to make (someone) more confident
rendition:
表演；演唱；演奏 
the performance of something, especially a song or piece of music; the particular way in 
which it is performed 
162
adoring:
崇拜的，敬慕的 
feeling or showing great affection and devotion
startle:
使受惊 
to surprise or frighten (someone) suddenly and usually not seriously
pensive:
沉思的，忧郁的 
quietly sad or thoughtful
preclude:
阻止 
to prevent (someone) from doing something
entreat:
恳求，乞求 
to ask (someone) in a serious and emotional way
culminate:
达到极点 
to reach the end or the final result of something
contrive:
常指用欺骗手段密谋 
to form or make (something) in a skillful or clever way
trim:
修剪；修整 
to make something neater, smaller, better, etc., by cutting parts from it

整齐的；精心照管的；井然有序的 
neat and well cared for

人 苗条的；修长的；健康优雅的 
(of a person) looking thin, healthy and attractive
compatriot:
同胞 
a person from the same country as someone else
yeast:
酵母；酵母菌 
a fungus used in making beer and wine, or to make bread rise
degenerate:
退化，恶化，衰退 
to become worse, weaker, less useful, etc.
quail:
感觉或显出恐惧；胆怯；畏缩 
to feel frightened or to show that you are frightened

鹌鹑；鹌鹑肉 
a small brown bird, whose meat and eggs are used for food; the meat of this bird 
163
uphold:
维护 
to support or defend (something, such as a law)

维持原判 
to judge (a legal decision) to be correct; to decide not to change (a verdict)
insoluble:
不能溶解的 
not able to be dissolved in a liquid

不能解决的，难以解释的 
not able to be solved or explained
heir:
继承人；后嗣 
a person who has the legal right to receive somebody's property, money or title when that 
person dies

工作或传统的继承者，承袭者，传人 
a person who is thought to continue the work or a tradition started by somebody else
connotation:
内涵 
an idea or quality that a word makes you think about in addition to its meaning
exhilarate:
使快活；使高兴 
to cause (someone) to feel very happy and excited
brittle:
易碎的，脆弱的 
easily broken or cracked 
have_a_stake_in_sth. comb. 有利害关系 
have a vested interest in sth.
varnish:
涂在木头或其他材料表面的清漆，罩光漆 
a liquid that is painted onto wood, metal, etc. and that forms a hard shiny transparent 
surface when it is dry

给 涂清漆 
to put varnish on the surface of something
diction:
用语，措辞 
the way in which words are used in speech or writing
riddle:
谜；谜语 
a question that is difficult to understand, and that has a surprising answer, that you ask 
somebody as a game

神秘事件；无法解释的情况 
a mysterious event or situation that you cannot explain 
164
plunge:
纵身跳入；使突然前冲 
to fall or jump suddenly from a high place; to push or thrust quickly

骤降 
to have a steep slope or drop downward
prank:
恶作剧 
a trick that is done to someone usually as a joke
rebuke:
指责，非难 
to speak in an angry and critical way to (someone)
